column4: anyone have any idea why might my video card not be showing up in the hardware component list in hardware drivers?
nvidia 8600m GS
hmm
there is no box :/
it would only show up there if you have the proprietary driver .. Do you ?
i dont believe i do
bobCFC yes, its not there.
that explains it i guess
how do i get them?
where would i get the proprietary driver?
look into a package called envyng-gtk (for ubuntu) or envyng-qt (for kubuntu)
hmm
are you talking about like apt-get nvidia-glx-new ?
or w/e?
yep, you can do that to get the envyng-gtk, but it might be informative to check Synaptic and search for envy, there are a few diffrent packages , all depends on your system
i've done that, and still even when i get the drivers that way, its stuck in 800x600... and the component still isn't listed in the hardware devices
hardware drivers*
does your /var/log/Xorg.0.log shows anything usefull to try and see what is wrong ?
what am i looking for?
an error line in that log starts with (EE) ..
you could pastebin it if you want, i'll take a look
(EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (Compatible NVIDIA X driver not found)
do you mind if i just paste it here?
please don't, that's a big log file, pastebin is made for these purposes ;)
